name: Introduction to Kotlin programming training   25/7/2017(Closed)
description:
Google Developers Summer Training – Gaza
introduction to Kotlin programming

Course Name: introduction to Kotlin programming
Trainer: Wafaa El-Ayoubi
The number of hours: 18 hours
training time: 25/7/2017 _ 15/8/2017
At Palestine Technical College – Gaza
Lab -2
Number of students: 5
Course Description
The course will introduce students to Kotlin programming. It assumes that students know the basics of scalar types (integers, stings, booleans) and fundamental control structures in procedural programming (loops, assignment statements, conditional expressions). It will focus on more sophisticated features such as design of classes, interfaces.

Course outcomes
Understand the concepts of the Kotlin language
Use Intellij, the popular Java (and Kotlin) IDE, to write code
Understand fundamentals of programming such as variables, conditional and iterative
execution, methods, etc.
Have the ability to write a computer program to solve specified problems.

name: Database Management System 20/7/2017 (Closed)
description:
Trainer: Abeer Karam
The number of hours: 18 hours
training time: 20/7/2017 _ 17/8/2017
At the Islamic University College of Information Technology
Room 103
Number of students: 15

Course Description
This course will give the students an in-depth understanding of database, database management systems, and the Query language of the database As well as this course teach the fundamentals of relational database relational Algebras , and the topics that are related to the database
Course outcomes this course is designed to achieve a number of goals :
• Fundamental understanding of the theory and practice of data representation, query languages, and their interrelationships.
• Exposure to leading data and query models including the Relational model , document and web search
• Experience with database management systems both in terms of using database software and in understanding how database software is implemented

name: PHP programming  training 15/7/2017 (Closed)
description:
Google Developers Summer Training – Gaza
Trainer: Kamla Baraka
The number of hours: 18 hours
training time: 15/7/2017 _ 2/8/2017
At the Islamic University College of Information Technology
Room I103
Number of students: 11
Course Description
• This course covers the development of interactive web pages or web enabled databases.
• Students will use PHP , Hypertext Pre-Processor, as open-source general-purpose scripting language and MySQL relational database as a backend to a web delivered interface.
• Students will learn the techniques of gathering data from users through Web forms, storing data in a database on the server and retrieving data from MySQL database.
Course Outcomes
• This course is designed to give students an in-depth understanding of web database, data and information models and modeling. In addition, this course is designed to achieve the following objectives:
• Fundamental understanding of the important of web database.
• Experience the fundamental use of PHP , MySQL and Apache as the famous tools for developing interactive web pages.

name: International Women Day 18-3-2017 (Closed)
description:
International Women Day by GDG Gaza has been held on Saturday the 18th of March in Gaza and Nablus. The event took place at Al-Mathaf hotel in Gaza and it started at 10:00 AM till 4:00 PM.

The schedule was going perfect and we started by introducing GDG and Women Techmakers then we started the first session with Ghadeer Abu-Oda talking about Machine learning and deep learning and mentioning Tensorflow as one of the used techniques for machine learning.

We have organized with Dr. Rawia Radi to be the speaker of this session, but due to a sever emergency she has suggested Ghadeer instead of her and the session was super awesome, we are thinking about recording a video with Ghadeer in order to share her experience in machine learning on our social media channels.

After Ghadeer, we started the second session connecting online with Eman Hylooz the founder of Abjjad talking about her entrepreneurship experience and her startup Abjjad with the attendees.

And the last speaker of this session was Haifa Bsieso, a very famous traveler and youtuber, we have presented a recorded video of Haifa' specially done for IWD talking to the girls and inspiring them by her story.

We also had Aseel Hanoon and Mohammed Abo El Qomboz, they both gave motivational sessions for the girls and the attendees were very happy. After a coffee break, we started a challenge between Gaza and Nablus, each of us asking a question to the attendees on the other side and the person who give the right answer received a gift.
The session was supposed to be conducted over Skype, but due to Internet connection problem in Nablus, we have been in contact over phone call.

The session finished and the attendees were very active and ready for a new technical session with Safa Lulu talking about Cloud Security, this session was very good as there was a discussion all the time between the attendees, the speaker and the conversation went very smoothly.

Finishing the talk about Cloud Security, we have hosted lunch for the attendees.

After that Maryam Lulu has led a debate session between two entrepreneurs and other two freelancers giving the girls the opportunity to differentiate between the two terms and the two jobs by showing real stories.

A panel discussion with three female leaders in Gaza followed the debate session. This session has been moderated by Ghadeer Abushaban asking the speakers some questions to help the attendees identify their career paths starting from the University level till the current period of their lives.

There were a lot of fun activities, we had a board for the girls to share their success stories, most favorite quotes and inspiring sentences.

Lots of them gave us a very awesome feedback on the board and they were very happy at the end of the event.

We had around 150 applicants registered for the event and around 70 attendees were accepted and invited officially, more than 90% of them were female.

In order to see more about the event, please visit our Facebook page:

www.facebook.com/gdggaza

name: DevFest  Gaza 2017
description:
Google Developers Group Gaza is proud to announce the GDG DevFest-Gaza-2017 which is the biggest Google related event in Gaza crafted by GDG community! The event will take place on October 27, 2017.

GDG DevFest are large, community-run events happening around the globe focused on community building and learning about Google’s technologies.

The event offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, all-day hack-a-thons, code labs, and more. Our sole aims of DevFest Gaza 17 is to provide multi speaker sessions and a codelab on areas play a core role in tech world as Machine learning, Tensorflow, UX and UI, Firebase, Auto AndroidÂ  and Google I/O.

We are targeting many attendees of Engineering/IT/ICT students, graduates and the ones who are interested to learn about Google technologies and cope with ICT challenges.

Registration link:

https://goo.gl/tTpeSD

#GDG #DevFest #DevFest17 #GDG_Gaza #DevFestGaza

name: Startup Weekend Disability
description:
• What we'll do
Startup Weekend Disability is organized to enforce Gazans entrepreneur’s social responsibility concept by encouraging them to innovate ideas that help in easing disabled people lives. Our goal of this event is to deliver the concept that solving the world’s most pressing challenges is not just the right thing to do, but also it is a good business. Why Disabled People? Statistics are clear; people with disabilities are not only less likely to be employed, but also less likely to pursue entrepreneurship. We hope that this event will ignite their entrepreneurial spark! We want to lead a generation to change the world!

name: Startup Weekend Palestine Uni.
description:
• What we'll do
Startup Weekend Palestine Uni. will be one of the special events of the year of 2018, it is organized especially for universities’ students and graduates who have ideas and want to implement it, it is about making their dreams become true. It will be the place where they work hard to convince others about their projects and ideas. The event follows Startup Weekend event themes, is a 54 hour event, where aspiring entrepreneurs, developers, designers, business specialists, marketers, and many talented entrepreneurs come together to share ideas, form teams, create prototypes, and launch startups. It’s more like an intensive course in entrepreneurship that lets them experience what it’s really like to build a startup. for more details, please follow the link: http://communities.techstars.com/palestine/gaza-palestine/startup-weekend/12255

• What to bring
Lots of energy! You'll pitch your own idea or listen to others, then vote on the most interesting ideas and form teams with diverse skill sets. You can come with friends, but you’ll get the full experience if you participate in separate teams. Remember, it’s all about the team.

• Important to know
Your idea should be something you have not previously worked on. The idea you pitch and the problem you set out to solve can span social, educational, financial, environmental, or other issues. Over the course of the weekend you'll be challenged to create a prototype of your MVP, or minimum viable product, that fits the needs of your target customer. You'll get feedback, iterate, and likely pivot your approach entirely! Important: You cannot have worked previously on your idea.

name: Mobile Web Study Jam 2018
description:
• What we'll do
Come join us for a Study Jams series on the mobile web, ending with an exam and Google certification on mobile web concepts.
Study Jams are community-run study groups for developers covering a range of Google Developers content.Typically, Study jams focus on completing a course, but some may focus on mastering a skill or product area.

*You can download the material from here:

name: Hash Code 2018 Competition
description:
• What we'll do
The Hash Code is a global team programming competition organized by Google for students and industry professionals across Europe, the Middle East and Africa; in which you pick your team and programming language, and Google picks an engineering problem for you to solve.

Google Hash Code competition runs over two rounds:
Round 1: (Qualification Round) which to take place on 1st March 2018.
Round 2: (Final Round) which to be held on 28th April 2018, as only top scoring teams of 1st round in the world will be invited to Google Dublin to compete in the Final Round of the competition.

The event of [GDG Palestine & Palestine TM (Gaza Hub)] - Google Hash Code will take place on March 1, 2018 from (06:00 pm and till 12:00 pm) in level up Restaurant. Never miss the opportunity ;) • What to bring
Your laptop and the great team of your own

• Important to know
You should be submitting your Google Application through this link to be considered: https://hashcode.withgoogle.com/signup.html

name: Cloud Study Jam2018 - Learn Google Cloud Basics
description:
Learn the fundamentals of the Google Cloud Platform, how to run containers on it and how to use the platform for data engineering. Attendees get free access to the labs ($70+ value).

At the end of the event, every attendee will be getting Google-hosted badges that they can add to enhance their online portfolios or to simply show-off their cloud skill to employers.

Agenda:
9:00am: Three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs
11:30am: Break
01:00pm: Intro to Docker or Scientific Data Processing lab
02:00pm: Event ends

name: International Women's Day - Gaza (IWD18)
description:
International Women's Day (IWD) is marked on March 8th every year. In different regions, the focus of celebrations ranges from general respect and appreciation toward women to a celebration of women's economic, political, and social achievements.

Google strives to cultivate a wholly inclusive workplace around the globe. A key component of that vision is empowering women to pursue their dreams and build tools that change the world. GDG Gaza and Women TechMakers reflect this vision through organizing events, workshops, and conferences for Women, powered by Google and International Women’s Day (IWD) is one example.

The event of this year has a distinct identity that merge the networking, challenging and entertainment with the renewed IWD topics. It does not has talk styles and challenges only, but also talk circles that fosters communication and networking among attendees and circle-facilitators. The event is focused on women success stories, renewed technologies, orientation, inspiration and other regional trending topics that women can participate in.

The event will take place on Saturday, 21st July 2018 (08:30 am - 05:00 pm).

Registration From:
https://goo.gl/forms/GROsAVTaV2gnu1A92

Note: ONLY whom have received acceptance for their participation-event application are able to confirm their attendance through following link:

Attendance Confirmation linke: https://goo.gl/forms/Mk6ygkpdGwUvmWp32

• What to bring
Your laptop is essential for practical sessions and the challenge.

• Important to know
Submitting application means you are including your name in Selection List, this is as seats are limited.
Thanks for your understanding :) .

name: Hackathon of Creativity (Al-Ebda' Hackathon) 2018
description:
Hackathon of Creativity (Ebda' Hackathon) 2018 is a 3-day event where budding entrepreneurs and innovative students and graduates of engineering, technology, medical and health science, education, medicine, and other faculties gather to do brainstorming to find solutions for health and medical related issue that would support and enhance health sector. Throughout event days, participants pitch ideas, find co-founders to form teams, seek mentorship and coaching sessions, then work on their prototypes and demos to present it in front of judgment panel and win event prizes.

The event will take place on the weekend of (15, 16 and 17) Nov, 2018.

For registration and further details, kindly visit event website herein:
www.hup.up.edu.ps

Best of Luck ~
